entry.title: WIND WARNING , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 11:06 PM NST Thursday 26 January 2023

entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 11:01 PM NST Thursday 26 January 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Light Rain, 1.1°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 02:28 AM NST Friday 27 January 2023
Condition: Light Rain
Temperature: 1.1°C
Pressure: 98.7 kPa
Visibility: 8.1 km
Humidity: 94 %
Dewpoint: 0.2°C
Wind: S 48 km/h gust 85 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: N/A

entry.title: Thursday night: Snow or rain. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning.
entry.summary: Snow and blowing snow changing to a few rain showers or periods of drizzle after midnight. Snowfall amount 10 to 15 cm. Wind becoming southeast 60 km/h gusting to 80 except gusting to 110 along parts of the coast overnight. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning. Wind chill minus 19 this evening. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Thursday 26 January 2023

entry.title: Friday: Chance of flurries or rain showers. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon. POP 40%
entry.summary: A few rain showers or flurries ending in the morning then mainly cloudy with 40 percent chance of flurries. Wind southwest 50 km/h gusting to 70 becoming west 30 gusting to 50 in the afternoon. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon. Wind chill minus 16 in the afternoon. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Thursday 26 January 2023

entry.title: Friday night: Clearing. Low minus 20.
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. Clearing overnight. Wind west 20 km/h gusting to 40. Low minus 20. Wind chill minus 15 in the evening and minus 29 overnight. Risk of frostbite. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Thursday 26 January 2023
